meanings.definition: A person who improvises, especially in music or theater.
meanings.sent1: The improvisators on stage amazed the audience with their quick thinking.
meanings.sent2: The improvisators in the jazz band created beautiful music on the spot.
meanings.sent3: The improvisators decided to perform a spontaneous play about a talking dog.
meanings.sent4: The improvisators were like magicians, conjuring up scenes out of thin air.
meanings.sent5: The improvisators were the stars of the show, shining brightly with their creativity.

meanings.definition: The act of improvising, especially in music or theater.
meanings.sent1: The improvisators of the play had to think on their feet when the prop broke.
meanings.sent2: The improvisators during the concert seamlessly adapted to unexpected changes.
meanings.sent3: The improvisators turned a wardrobe malfunction into a hilarious scene.
meanings.sent4: The improvisators painted a vivid picture with their spontaneous melodies.
meanings.sent5: The improvisators brought life to the stage with their impromptu performances.
